itineraries.title: Central Vietnam: Imperial Heritage & Coastal Wonders

visits.text: Imperial Citadel of Hue, second citadel protecting most important palaces
Forbidden City dedicated to the king and royal family
Temples of Nguyen ancestors within the citadel
Thuy Tien Lake Park, abandoned water park built in 2004 with magical beauty

activities.text: Explore wide Royal Citadel area requiring half day to full day
Visit palaces and royal palace works throughout the complex
Check-in at mysterious abandoned park popular with foreign visitors
Explore broken water pipes and unfinished aquarium
Witness creepy invasion of nature in abandoned structures

visits.text: Hai Van Pass, 25km mountain pass at 500m above sea level
Highest pass in Vietnam crossing Truong Son mountain range
Da Nang Bay panoramic views from winding mountain roads

activities.text: Motorcycle trip through Hai Van Pass taking 3-5 hours with stops
Experience winding roads, sudden curves and blind corners
Enjoy gorgeous views of Da Nang Bay from 500m elevation
Rent motorbike from Da Nang hotels at VND 150,000-200,000 per day
Stop for meals along the scenic mountain route

visits.text: Ba Na Hills founded by French with cool alpine climate
Golden Bridge with two giant stone hands holding golden walkway
French village and entertainment complex at mountain top

activities.text: Ride very long cable cars to the top of the mountain
Experience fairytale scenery covered with trees
Visit Golden Bridge that spread quickly on social networks
Explore many special works throughout the complex
Stay overnight at Ba Na Hills for relaxed experience
Enjoy cool alpine climate at mountain resort

visits.text: Hoi An Ancient Town with yellow houses and red tile roofs
Lanterns hanging everywhere throughout the old town
Bay Mau Coconut Forest feeling like West River Mekong
Small rivers, canals and ditches with coconut groves

activities.text: Enjoy full natural scenery without high-rise buildings
Experience rowing or basket boat through coconut waterways
Navigate through canals with coconut groves interspersed on both sides
Experiment as fishermen or participate in water games
Book day tour with local guide to visit all destinations
Experience fun places and attractive dining of coconut forest
Explore characteristic yellow houses with hanging lanterns

visits.text: Ky Co Beach, one of famous beaches of Quy Nhon
Eo Gio coastal area near Ky Co beach

activities.text: Travel between Eo Gio and Ky Co by boat or canoe in 30-40 minutes
Immerse yourself in idyllic rustic life at developing destination
Experience rhythm of local people in simple accommodations
Enjoy fresh seafood directly from the sea
Experience complete holiday in pristine beach setting
Discover early-stage tourism destination with authentic atmosphere

seo.h1_title: Central Vietnam Heritage Road: An Itinerary from Imperial Hue to Hoi An's Lanterns
seo.intro_paragraph: Live cultural Vietnam in fast-forward: Hue and its citadel, then Hai Van Pass above clouds. Detour through Ba Na Hills for unexpected scenery, lose yourself in Hoi An between lanterns and patios, then settle at Quy Nhon, quiet beaches and Cham towers in the background.
seo.seo_hook: Explore Hue's imperial citadels, cross spectacular mountain passes and let yourself be charmed by Hoi An and its lanterns. Central Vietnam will captivate you.
featured_list: Hue: Nguyen dynasty citadel imperial
Hoi An: merchant port lantern magic
Ba Na Hills: golden bridge fantasy
Quy Nhon: quiet beaches Cham towers

places_taglines.VN::hue: nguyen emperors citadel royal tombs incense
places_taglines.VN::da-nang: marble mountains dragon bridge hai van
places_taglines.VN::ba-na-hills: golden bridge french village cable car
places_taglines.VN::hoi-an: japanese bridge lantern festival tailor streets
places_taglines.VN::quy-nhon: pristine beaches cham ruins coastal serenity

visits.text: Hanoi Old Quarter, vibrant chaotic historic heart perfect for wandering
Hoan Kiem Lake, iconic central lake for people-watching
Temple of Literature (Van Mieu), Vietnam's first university from 1070
Ho Chi Minh Mausoleum Complex, preserved body of national hero
West Lake (Ho Tay) and Tran Quoc Pagoda, Hanoi's largest lake with ancient pagoda
Long Bien Bridge, historic French-built cantilever bridge over Red River
Quang Ba Flower Market, pre-dawn wholesale flower market experience

activities.text: Navigate Old Quarter by cyclo tour at 150-200k VND per hour
Experience authentic street food scene with pho, bun cha, banh mi on plastic stools
Watch sunset at Tran Quoc Pagoda on West Lake islet
Walk or cycle Long Bien Bridge at sunset for best photos
Visit Quang Ba Flower Market between 3-5 AM for full chaotic spectacle
Allow 1-2 hours at Temple of Literature with 30k VND entry
Observe strict dress code at Mausoleum with shoulders and knees covered
Take sampan boat tour through Tam Coc caves at 120k VND plus 120k VND entrance

visits.text: Tam Coc - Bich Dong, Ha Long Bay on land with limestone caves and rice paddies
Trang An Scenic Landscape Complex, UNESCO World Heritage boat labyrinth
Mua Cave (Hang Mua), 500 steps to iconic dragon statue viewpoint
Thung Nham Bird Park, natural sanctuary with thousands of birds at sunset

activities.text: Experience longer Trang An boat tour at $50 per person for 12 hours
Climb Mua Cave for sunrise or sunset panoramic views at 100k VND entry
Visit Thung Nham between 4:30-5:30 PM for prime bird-watching at 100k VND entry
Arrive early morning at Tam Coc to avoid crowds
Trek through rice terraces and authentic Thai villages

visits.text: Pu Luong Nature Reserve with magnificent terraced rice fields
Thai ethnic minority villages with authentic homestay experience
Pu Luong waterfalls and lush forest trekking trails

activities.text: Experience homestay with local Thai ethnic minority families
Swim in natural pools beneath cascading waterfalls
Enjoy less crowded alternative to Sapa on 2-day tours from Hanoi at $150-300
Explore rice paddies during golden harvest season
Rent local motorbike to explore scenic tea hills

visits.text: Moc Chau highland plateau with expansive green tea plantations
Dairy farms producing fresh milk and cheese products
Seasonal flower fields with white plum blossoms and mustard flowers

activities.text: Visit white plum flower fields in late January to February
See mustard flower blooms during winter months
Enjoy cooler highland climate and scenic mountain drives
Sample fresh dairy products from local farms
Trek through stunning rice terraces with local guide

visits.text: Sapa terraced rice fields with guided trekking to ethnic minority villages
Fansipan Peak, Roof of Indochina at 3,143m accessible by cable car
O Quy Ho Pass, Heaven's Gate with panoramic Hoang Lien Son views
Cat Cat Village with H'Mong culture and traditional crafts
Ta Van Village in peaceful Muong Hoa Valley

activities.text: Stay in ethnic minority homestay at 150-300k VND per night
Take cable car to Fansipan summit at 750k VND return ticket
Drive O Quy Ho Pass 45 minutes from Sapa on clear day
Book 2-day trekking tour from Hanoi with homestay at $80-100
Prepare for cold and fog at Fansipan even in summer
Ride Muong Hoa Mountain Train through scenic valley
Photograph golden rice terraces during harvest season late September to mid-October

visits.text: Mu Cang Chai terraced rice fields, Vietnam's most spectacular and sprawling terraces
La Pan Tan village viewpoints over endless rice paddy layers
Che Cu Nha terraced fields stretching across mountain slopes

activities.text: Visit during reflective planting season May to June for water-filled paddies
Explore remote mountain roads by sturdy motorbike
Experience authentic Hmong village life in remote highlands
Allow 7-8 hours drive from Hanoi for photographer's dream destination
Rent motorbike at 150-250k VND per day for loop adventure

visits.text: Ha Giang Loop, 3-5 day motorbike adventure through rugged northernmost province
Dong Van Karst Plateau Geopark, UNESCO-recognized dramatic limestone formations
Ma Pi Leng Pass with epic canyon views and hairpin turns
Dong Van Old Quarter with ancient Hmong houses
Lung Cu Flag Tower at Vietnam's northernmost point

activities.text: Hire easy rider local driver at 700k-1M VND per day including food and lodging
Stop at Ma Pi Leng Pass for breathtaking canyon photography
Experience remote ethnic minority cultures in traditional villages
Navigate challenging mountain roads with dramatic karst scenery
Visit deep canyons and traditional villages throughout geopark
Take bamboo raft ride right up to waterfall base at 50k VND

visits.text: Ban Gioc Waterfall (Thac Ban Gioc), colossal multi-tiered falls on Vietnam-China border
Nguom Ngao Cave, impressive stalactite cave near Ban Gioc

activities.text: Pay 45k VND entrance fee to waterfall area
Photograph stunning multi-tiered cascades straddling international border
Explore Nguom Ngao Cave system near the falls
Complete long but rewarding journey from Ha Giang
Take full-day boat tour at 600-800k VND for the boat

visits.text: Ba Be Lake, vast serene freshwater lake in national park
Puong Cave with thousands of bats
Dau Dang Waterfall cascading through jungle
Tay ethnic stilt house villages around the lake

activities.text: Visit caves and waterfalls accessible only by boat
Experience Tay ethnic culture in traditional stilt house homestays
Enjoy peaceful escape 5-6 hours from Hanoi
Kayak on calm lake waters surrounded by forest
Book overnight cruise with kayaking and cave visits from $140-180 USD per person

visits.text: Ha Long Bay, quintessential North Vietnam experience with limestone karsts
Lan Ha Bay, less crowded alternative with cleaner water for swimming
Cat Ba Island, largest island in bay with beaches and national park
Sung Sot Cave (Surprise Cave), one of largest grottoes in Ha Long Bay
Hospital Cave on Cat Ba, historic wartime medical facility

activities.text: Kayak through emerald waters among towering karsts
Swim in cleaner Lan Ha Bay waters
Explore Cat Ba National Park hiking trails
Take ferry from Hai Phong or Ha Long City to Cat Ba
Rent motorbike on Cat Ba to explore island beaches
Visit Hospital Cave hidden in jungle hillside
Final shopping for souvenirs in Old Quarter

visits.text: Return to Hanoi for departure or continuation

activities.text: Last street food experience before departure
Complete North Vietnam circuit back to starting point
Terminer le circuit du Nord Vietnam en revenant au point de départ

seo.h1_title: Northern Vietnam Highlands: Sapa Rice Terraces and Mountain Pass Adventure
seo.intro_paragraph: Set off for adventure Vietnam: Ninh Binh on water, Pu Luong on foot, then Sapa in mist. Photograph Mu Cang Chai and its golden terraces, loop Ha Giang on spectacular roads, continue to Cao Bang and its waterfalls, then end at Ba Be Lake, calm and deep.
seo.seo_hook: Admire Sapa's terraced rice paddies, take dizzying mountain roads and meet ethnic minorities in their traditional villages. Northern Vietnam must be earned.
featured_list: Ha Giang: legendary loop mountain passes
Sapa: misty peaks ethnic villages
Mu Cang Chai: golden rice terraces
Ba Be: serene lake forest sanctuary

places_taglines.VN::hanoi: hoan kiem lake egg coffee departure point
places_taglines.VN::ninh-binh: bai dinh pagoda karst boat rides caves
places_taglines.VN::pu-luong: terraced valleys white thai stilt villages
places_taglines.VN::moc-chau: tea plantations dairy farms plateau blooms
places_taglines.VN::sapa: fansipan peak hmong markets valley treks
places_taglines.VN::mu-cang-chai: golden rice sculptures photographer paradise terraces
places_taglines.VN::ha-giang: ma pi leng pass dong van plateau
places_taglines.VN::cao-bang: ban gioc waterfall limestone peaks frontier
places_taglines.VN::ba-be: emerald lake forested shores peaceful retreat
places_taglines.VN::ha-long: world wonder karst bays fishing villages
places_taglines.VN::hanoi-end: return capital lakeside farewell pho bowls

itineraries.title: Southern Vietnam: Vibrant Cities, Islands & Dunes

visits.text: Ben Thanh Market, bustling market with local handicrafts and cuisine
Saigon Opera House (Municipal Theatre), fine French Colonial architecture
Bitexco Financial Tower SkyDeck with panoramic city views
War Remnants Museum presenting Vietnam War and Indochina War exhibits
Cu Chi Tunnels used by Viet Cong during Vietnam War
Notre-Dame Cathedral Basilica of Saigon with neo-Romanesque architecture
Reunification Palace (Independence Palace), former presidential palace
Jade Emperor Pagoda, atmospheric Taoist pagoda with divine statues
Tan Dinh Church with distinctive pink exterior

activities.text: Experience world-class street food scene with pho, bun cha, banh mi
Try Modern Vietnamese Contemporary Cuisine at Capsule Restaurant
Explore vibrant nightlife on Bui Vien Street backpacker haven
Visit underground electronic clubs like The Observatory and Lighthouse
Tour District 1 rooftop bars for stunning cityscape views
Take Saigon River Cruise with dinner and cultural performances
Shop at local wet markets and luxury malls like Takashimaya
Explore Cu Chi Tunnels and learn guerrilla warfare tactics
Use Grab or Gojek ridesharing apps for navigation
Join guided street food tour for safety and discovery at 30-80k VND per meal

visits.text: Cai Rang Floating Market, famous colorful wholesale market on water
Vinh Trang Pagoda offering insights into regional heritage
An Binh Island near Vinh Long with serene landscapes and fruit orchards
Tra Su Cajuput Forest in An Giang for bird watching
Tram Chim National Park excellent for seeing rare Sarus crane

activities.text: Take essential boat tour through Mekong River canals
Visit floating market in early morning when most active
Explore river life around My Tho and Ben Tre
Watch locals trading goods from boats at floating markets
Walk through tropical fruit orchards and taste fresh fruits
Sample local cuisine at village eateries or join cooking class
Experience agri-tourism visiting rice farms and fish farming
Stay at homestay for full immersion in local culture
Rent bicycle to cover ground and explore small villages
Go off beaten track to discover memorable landscapes

visits.text: Phu Quoc National Park, UNESCO World Heritage site with diverse ecosystems
Dinh Cau Night Market in Duong Dong for street food and souvenirs
Pearl farms to learn cultivation process and purchase jewelry
Fish sauce factories producing world's best fish sauce
VinPearl Safari, best and most ethical zoo in Vietnam
Hon Thom Island via world's longest overseas cable car
Ganh Dau fishing village for authentic local life
Ham Ninh fishing village observing daily routines
Sao Beach pristine white sand in the south
Ong Lang Beach with golden sand

activities.text: Flight from Can Tho to Phu Quoc Island
Hike and trek through national park diverse ecosystems
Snorkel or dive to explore diverse marine life
Take boat trip to southern islands and floating restaurants
Join fishing trip or boat tour to surrounding islands
Ride cable car to Hon Thom Island for breathtaking views
Watch sunset at Dinh Cau Rock and Cau Temple
Rent motorbike to explore island at your own pace
Try street food specialties bun quay and bun ken
Beware of jellyfish during certain seasons before swimming

visits.text: Con Dao National Park covering most of island with diverse ecosystems
Con Dao Prison (Coconut Tree Prison), infamous wartime museum
Hang Duong Cemetery resting place of Vietnamese revolutionaries
Con Dao Museum with comprehensive island history overview
Con Dao Lighthouse with panoramic island views
An Son Shrine connected to Lady Phi Yen legend
Nhat Beach, Dam Trau Beach, Lo Voi Beach pristine beaches
Bay Canh Island, Hon Tai Island, Hon Cau Island for secluded experience

activities.text: Flight from Phu Quoc to Con Dao Island
Explore pristine beaches with clear waters for diving and snorkeling
Watch sea turtles nesting June through September
Hike to Con Dao Lighthouse for spectacular panoramic views
Take boat tours to surrounding tropical islands
Visit historical sites related to prison island legends
Experience secluded island escape away from crowds
Book accommodations in advance during peak season
Bring laptop and book as nightlife is limited
Visit November through April for best weather and clearest waters

visits.text: Christ the King statue similar to Rio's Christ the Redeemer
Vung Tau Lighthouse, one of oldest in Vietnam with coastal views
White Palace (Bach Dinh), colonial-era mansion museum
Ho May Park on Big Mountain accessible by cable car
Niet Ban Tinh Xa Hindu Pagoda near Pineapple Beach
Worldwide Arms Museum with centuries-old weapons collection
Back Beach (Bai Sau), largest and most popular beach
Front Beach (Bai Truoc) with calm waters and sunset views
Pineapple Beach (Bai Dua) for snorkeling
Paradise Beach (Bai Dau) secluded near mountains

activities.text: Flight from Con Dao to Ho Chi Minh City then drive to Vung Tau
Climb to top of Christ the King statue for panoramic views
Take scenic cable car ride at Ho May Park
Walk along well-kept boardwalk with sea views
Golf at world-class Vung Tau Paradise Golf Course
Swim and sunbathe at Back Beach golden sand
Watch sunset at Front Beach picturesque western views
Sample local street food including dried fish and banh khot
Consider side trip to Phuoc Hai for authentic fishing village
Stay at Ho Tram Strip for upscale resort experience

visits.text: White Sand Dunes, iconic towering dunes for sandboarding
Red Sand Dunes closer to town famous for sunset views
Fairy Stream shallow stream through dunes and rock formations
Fishing Village with colorful boats and daily catch
Po Shanu Cham Towers dating back to 8th century
Mui Ne Beach long golden sand with strong winds and waves
Ta Cu Mountain with reclining Buddha statue at Linh Son Truong Tho pagoda

activities.text: Kitesurf, paraglide, or windsurf at excellent wind condition beaches
Take thrilling jeep tour across landscape visiting dunes and villages
Ride ATV on sandy dunes around Mui Ne
Try stand-up paddleboarding on calm waters
Mountain bike through hilly terrain and rural landscapes
Trek Ta Cu Mountain for panoramic views over one hour west of town
Walk along shallow Fairy Stream through otherworldly rock formations
Sandboard down towering White Sand Dunes
Watch sunset at Red Sand Dunes for spectacular color display
Enjoy excellent local seafood at Mui Ne restaurants
Visit December through April for best weather and wind speeds

seo.h1_title: Southern Vietnam: Ho Chi Minh City, Mekong Delta and Sand Dunes
seo.intro_paragraph: Taste the south: Ho Chi Minh City and its energy, then Can Tho at dawn amid market boats. Escape to Phu Quoc and its beaches, or Con Dao and its preserved nature, then find Vung Tau and its colonial heritage. End at Mui Ne, red and white dunes facing sea.
seo.seo_hook: Dive into Saigon's buzz, wake up on a Mekong Delta floating market and discover Mui Ne's red dunes. Southern Vietnam is a land of contrasts.
featured_list: Phu Quoc: palm beaches island paradise
Con Dao: pristine wilderness remote beauty
Mui Ne: red white sand dunes
Can Tho: dawn floating market boats

places_taglines.VN::ho-chi-minh-city: scooter chaos rooftop bars pho streets
places_taglines.VN::can-tho: floating markets dawn mekong delta heart
places_taglines.VN::phu-quoc: pearl island beaches night market seafood
places_taglines.VN::con-dao: former prison paradise untouched beaches turtles
places_taglines.VN::vung-tau: french lighthouse beaches saigon weekend escape
places_taglines.VN::mui-ne: red dunes white dunes kite surfing

visits.text: My Son Holy Land, ancient Cham civilization capital UNESCO World Heritage Site
Seventy Hindu-like towers and temples dated from 2nd century
Tra Kieu Church and Sa Huynh-Champa Cultural Museum nearby

activities.text: Explore one of Vietnam's best-preserved Cham temple systems
Experience sense of beauty combined with grandeur of nature
Photograph amazing architectural imprints of ancient people
Walk through narrow valley surrounded by springs, mountains and dense jungles
Pay 150,000 VND adult entrance, free for children under 15
Park scooter for 10,000 VND
Located 60km from Da Nang, 75km from Hoi An, 150km from Hue

visits.text: Cam Thanh Coconut Village, green lung of Hoi An like miniature Mekong Delta
Bay Mau water coconut forest over 100 hectares

activities.text: Ride Vietnamese bamboo basket boat through coconut palm forest
Listen to sweet folk songs sung by boat rower
Watch entertaining show of dancers rocking boat skilfully with paddle
Discover locals catching fish and crab in waterways
Experience adventure of swinging and shaking basket boat
Try fresh coconut milk in 200-year-old coconut forest
Rent basket boat for two tourists at 150,000 VND with friendly boatman
Visit January to June for cool weather ideal for water activities

visits.text: Hoi An Ancient Town, UNESCO World Heritage meeting place of civilizations
Japanese Covered Bridge, holy beauty in middle of Old Town
Tan Ky Old House over 200 years old
Folk Culture Museum for excellent Hoi An discovery
Tra Que Village vegetable garden 3km from Hoi An

activities.text: Explore diverse Chinese, Japanese and Vietnamese architecture
Bike along tiny lanes from Thu Bon River to Cua Dai Beach
Cycle through green paddy fields to surrounding villages
Join Hoi An cooking class to discover central Vietnamese food secrets
Book Red Bridge Cooking School or Tra Que Water Wheel Organic Farm class
Watch Hoi An Memories Show with 500-piece ensemble in 3,000-seat stadium
Buy paper lanterns and place them on Hoai River making wishes in evening
Book Memories Show tickets 600,000-900,000 VND for adults, 300,000-450,000 VND for children
Take taxi or Grab from Da Nang at $15-20, or bus at $1 one-way

visits.text: Ba Na Hills and Golden Bridge, giant hands holding golden walkway at 1414m altitude
Sun World Ba Na Hills cable car and French village complex
My Khe Beach, sparkling blue waters year-round
Son Tra Peninsula with Linh Ung Pagoda and largest Buddha statue in Vietnam

activities.text: Walk 150m Golden Bridge pedestrian walkway above clifftop with city views
Ride Ba Na cable car and explore Love Garden and Wax Museum
Visit Fantasy Theme Amusement Park with 4D Movie included in ticket
Swim at My Khe Beach, Thanh Binh Beach or Non Nuoc Beach
Enjoy cool climate at Linh Ung Pagoda on Son Tra Peninsula
Book Ba Na Hills ticket in advance at 750,000 VND for adults, 600,000 VND for children
Start Ba Na Hills visit before 8:00 AM to see and do all things

visits.text: Hai Van Pass scenic mountain road with panoramic views
Lang Co Beach and Cau Hai Lagoon fishing village
Hue Imperial Citadel, UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1993
Thien Mu Pagoda on picturesque Perfume River
Tu Duc Tomb, masterpiece of romantic architecture and nature harmony
Khai Dinh Tomb with Asian-European style combination

activities.text: Drive scenic Hai Van Pass for wonderful sightseeing
Explore three rings of ramparts at 500-hectare Imperial Citadel
Visit Ngo Mon Gate main entrance and Thai Hoa Palace core
Watch traditional Tuong plays at Duyet Thi Duong royal theater
Feel dreamy romantic Hue atmosphere at Thien Mu Pagoda from 6-8 AM
Cruise Perfume River at night and listen to Hue traditional folk songs
Taste Hue royal cuisine including Beef Noodle, Steamed Rice Cake, crispy pancake
Shop at Dong Ba Market for local products
Pay 200,000 VND adult entrance to Citadel, 40,000 VND for children 7-12

visits.text: Thien Duong Cave (Paradise Cave) in Phong Nha Ke Bang National Park
Underground palace of Heaven aged 350-400 million years

activities.text: Marvel at majestic stalactite and stalagmite system with shimmering beauty
Explore one of wonders of most mystical planet in UNESCO World Natural Heritage
Experience divine palace on earth beyond human imagination
Take buggy electric car transfer to cave entrance at 40,000 VND
Pay 250,000 VND entrance fee per person

seo.h1_title: Central Vietnam Heritage: Imperial Hue, Phong Nha Caves & Hoi An
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore central Vietnam: My Son at sunrise, then Cam Thanh paddling under water coconut palms. Wander through Hoi An, climb Da Nang's marble mountains, breathe Hue's grandeur, and dive into Phong Nha's monumental caves, natural cathedrals at jungle's heart.
seo.seo_hook: Set out to discover jungle-lost temples, explore vast caves carved by underground rivers. Central Vietnam is made for adventurers.
featured_list: Phong Nha: cathedral caves underground rivers
My Son: Cham temples jungle ruins
Hoi An: heritage streets yellow walls
Hue: citadel pagodas perfume river

seo.h1_title: Vietnam's History Trail: Hanoi, Halong Bay, Hue & Hoi An
seo.intro_paragraph: Hike through Pu Luong amid rice terraces, explore Ninh Binh the 'land Ha Long', then sail to Ha Long Bay and its dreamlike setting. Dive into Hue and its palaces, breathe Hoi An, then descend to Ho Chi Minh City: a complete itinerary unfolding Vietnam's most beautiful layers.
seo.seo_hook: From terraced rice paddies to imperial citadels to karst peaks, Vietnam offers landscapes where history reads at every stop.
featured_list: Pu Luong: rice terraces mountain homestays
Ninh Binh: landlocked halong karst river
Halong Bay: emerald waters sailing junks
Hue: forbidden purple citadel imperial

seo.h1_title: Classic Vietnam: Hanoi, Sapa, Halong Bay & Mekong Delta
seo.intro_paragraph: Discover Vietnam north to south: Hanoi and its history-scented streets, Ha Long Bay and its karsts rising from water, Hue and its imperial heritage, Hoi An and its lanterns. End in the Mekong Delta, floating markets and river life, where the country beats to water's rhythm.
seo.seo_hook: Sail among Halong Bay's karsts, wander lantern-lit ancient streets and wake at dawn on a floating market. Vietnam will enchant you from north to south.
featured_list: Halong Bay: limestone karsts emerald waters
Hoi An: lantern streets ancient charm
Mekong Delta: floating markets river life
Hue: imperial citadel perfume river
